GapFillInput.Title: Special uses of the continuous forms
GapFillInput.Instruction: Type the word(s) in brackets in the correct form in each gap. Use short forms. One sentence requires a simple form. Which is it?

Content.Question:
1. Johnny’s got such a positive personality; he's always smiling (always / smile) and is optimistic
about whatever he does.
2. I was hoping (hope) you could give me some tips for my interview at the law firm next week.
3. What are you doing (do) over the summer holidays?
4. Andrew’s a very gifted tennis player. He might be playing (play) at Wimbledon next year if
he qualifies.
5. It’s very quiet! The children must be doing (do) their homework in the study.
6. When Imogen was little her parents were forever praising (forever / praise) her, and now she is
a really confident young woman.
7. I'm always running (always / run) late for my appointments at the moment. I must try and organise my time better.
8. Henri was wondering (wonder) if we could help out with the summer holiday activities.
9. We haven’t seen our friends in Ireland for months. I must phone (phone) them and invite them over for the weekend.
10. Dylan is forever talking (talk) about leaving his job and travelling round the world.
Do you think he’ll actually do it?
